marketNews.title: Danantara Will Restructure & Consolidate SOEs Until the End of 2025
marketNews.content: Danantara COO, Dony Oskaria, stated on Wednesday (7/23) that his party has 22 work programs to be carried out until the end of 2025. Although he did not explain them in detail, Dony mentioned that these work programs include restructuring, consolidation, and business development for SOEs, consisting of:1. Restructuring in 4 sectors, namely airline business, steel manufacturing, high-speed rail, and insurance.2. Business consolidation in 9 sectors, namely construction business, fertilizer, hospital, hotel, sugar, oil downstreaming, insurance, asset management, and industrial estates.3. Business development will target the cooperative business sector, food, batteries, cement, sharia banking, telecommunications, and the shipbuilding industry.Regarding the consolidation plan for State-Owned Construction Companies (BUMN Karya), Dony stated that his party will consolidate subsidiaries that are not directly related to the core business. The consolidation plan for State-Owned Construction Companies is not new, considering this discourse has emerged since 2023.Meanwhile, Member of Commission VI of the DPR, Ahmad Labib, reminded Danantara to avoid the conglomerate model in implementing SOE consolidation and transformation programs. Ahmad stated that the conglomerate model previously applied by SOEs was unproductive and often became a source of inefficiency in the past.Kontan reported that Danantara and Commission XI of the DPR also held a closed meeting on Wednesday (7/23). The Chairman of Commission XI of the DPR, Mukhamad Misbakhun, explained that the meeting was held in a closed session because several matters conveyed by Danantara were feared to affect the market, given that the information was insider in nature.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The success of Danantara in recovering and developing SOEs in the future can strengthen Danantara's own capitalization. However, execution is the key factor that needs attention from investors, in addition to details regarding the programs/schemes to be implemented.The movement of SOE stock prices overall has had a quite positive sentiment since Danantara was launched on February 24, 2025. Since that date, the IDXBUMN20 index has increased by +6.24%, with ANTM (+85%), PGEO (+69%) and PTPP (+53%) as the top 3 emitters with the highest stock price increases. This IDXBUMN20 increase is higher than IDX30 (+3.58%) and LQ45 (+3.88%) which are more concentrated on large SOE banks only.

marketNews.title: DPR ratified the post-budget posture for 2026 assuming economic growth around +5.2-5.8% YoY, inflation around 1.5-3.5% YoY, rupiah exchange rate against the dollar around 16,500-16,900, 10-year SBN yield around 6.6-7.2%, Indonesia Crude Oil price around 60-80 US dollars per barrel, oil lifting around 605-620 thousand barrels per day, and natural gas lifting around 953-1,017 thousand barrels of oil equivalent per day.
marketNews.content: The DPR ratified the results of the discussion on the posture of the 2026 Draft State Budget (RAPBN) on Thursday (7/24), with a deficit target of approximately 2.48-2.53% of GDP. This posture assumes economic growth of around +5.2-5.8% YoY, inflation of around 1.5-3.5% YoY, a rupiah exchange rate against the dollar of around 16,500-16,900, a 10-year SBN yield of around 6.6-7.2%, an Indonesia Crude Oil price of around 60-80 US dollars per barrel, oil lifting of around 605-620 thousand barrels per day, and natural gas lifting of around 953-1,017 thousand barrels of oil equivalent per day.

marketNews.title: Government prepares continuation of stimulus packages for 3Q25
marketNews.content: The spokesperson for the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Haryo Limanseto, stated on Wednesday (7/23) that the government plans to continue the economic stimulus package program in 3Q25 to maintain economic growth. Although he did not detail the contents of the stimulus package, Haryo explained that the stimulus package draft will be finalized this week. This package will continue the stimulus package worth 24.4 trillion rupiah disbursed in June-July 2025.

marketNews.title: ESDM asks mining companies to submit new RKAB in October
marketNews.content: The Director General at the Ministry of ESDM, Tri Winarno, stated that his party requested mining companies to submit the new Work Plan and Budget (RKAB) for the 2026 period in October 2025. This step follows an agreement between the Ministry of ESDM and the DPR regarding the change in RKAB duration from once every 3 years to once every year.

marketNews.title: US-EU close 15 tariff deal, FT reports
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that the European Union and the US are close to reaching a trade agreement that will cause the US to lower import tariffs from the EU from 30% to 15%, a level similar to the agreement between the US-Japan. Both the EU and the US are also reported to eliminate tariffs on several products, including aircraft, alcoholic beverages, and medical equipment. The US and the EU have not commented on this news.

tickerNews.title: Djarum Group Entity Acquires Treasury Shares of SSIA
tickerNews.content: Surya Semesta Internusa announced that Djarum group entity, PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan, has taken over approximately 62.9 million treasury shares of the company on July 22, 2025, at a price of 2,700 rupiah per share, which is about +3.8% higher than SSIA's stock price as of Thursday (7/24). The number of treasury shares is equivalent to a 1.34% ownership stake, and after this transaction, SSIA no longer holds treasury shares. PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan itself holds 7.36% of SSIA shares, based on KSEI data as of July 22, 2025.

tickerNews.title: CDIA Commissioner Purchased Shares
tickerNews.content: Chandra Daya Investasi Commissioner, Andre Khor Kah Hin, bought 15 million CDIA shares at an average price of 800 rupiah per share on July 17, 2025. The total transaction value reached 12 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Andre Khor Kah Hin's direct ownership in CDIA increased from none to 0.012%.

tickerNews.title: BSDE's Marketing Sales Reached IDR 5.1 Trillion in 1H25, 51% of Target
tickerNews.content: Bumi Serpong Damai recorded marketing sales of 2.7 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (+1% YoY, +9% QoQ). This result brought the marketing sales for 1H25 to 5.1 trillion rupiah (+5% YoY), equivalent to 51% of the 2025 target of 10 trillion rupiah. The contributors to the 1H25 marketing sales came from the 'residential' segment (43%), followed by 'shop houses' (25%), 'commercial' (15%), 'land plot sales to joint ventures' (12%), and 'apartments' (5%). BSDE explained that the solid performance in 1H25 provides a strong foundation for the company to pursue its annual target, which is reinforced by the BI Rate decrease policy.

tickerNews.title: PAM Mineral to Distribute 2nd Interim Dividend for 2025 Books
tickerNews.content: PAM Mineral announced it will distribute the 2nd interim dividend for the 2025 book year amounting to 159.5 billion rupiah or 15 rupiah per share. This amount indicates a dividend yield of 1.2% as of Thursday (7/24). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is August 1, 2025, while the payment date is August 12, 2025. Previously, NICL also distributed an interim dividend for the 2025 book year amounting to 15 rupiah per share on June 30, 2025.

tickerNews.title: JSMR Announces Change of Control in PT Jasamarga Jogja Solo to Single Control by JSMR
tickerNews.content: Jasa Marga announced a change of control in PT Jasamarga Jogja Solo to single control by JSMR. Previously, PT Jasamarga Jogja Solo was under joint control with Adhi Karya (ADHI). The change of control was carried out through an amendment to the shareholders' agreement, so no transaction value arose. After this change of control, JSMR will consolidate PT Jasamarga Jogja Solo in its financial statements. PT Jasamarga Jogja Solo, which holds the concession for the Solo-Yogyakarta-NYIA Kulonprogo toll road, will be singularly controlled by JSMR.

tickerNews.title: PT PP Recorded Net Profit of IDR 6 Billion in 2Q25
tickerNews.content: PT PP recorded a net profit of 6 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (-89% YoY, -90.1% QoQ), resulting in a net profit of 65 billion rupiah for 1H25 (-56% YoY). Revenue in 2Q25 decreased to 3.2 trillion rupiah (-23.5% YoY, -8.7% QoQ), so that revenue for 1H25 decreased by -23.7% YoY to 6.7 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: CGAS Targets IDR 650 Billion Revenue in 2025 with New CNG Stations and LNG Project in Karawang Potentially Contributing IDR 120 Billion Annually
tickerNews.content: Bisnis and Kompas reported that Citra Nusantara Gemilang's LNG facility in Karawang, West Java, has the potential to provide additional revenue to the company of approximately 120 billion rupiah per year, equivalent to 23.6% of total revenue for 2024. The facility is targeted to operate by the end of 2026. Furthermore, CGAS President Director, Andika Purwonugroho, stated that the company is optimistic about achieving a total revenue of approximately 650 billion rupiah in 2025, growing by about +28% YoY compared to 2024 realization, along with the operation of 3 new compressed natural gas (CNG) stations this year. The hope is that the production rate of the new CNG stations can reach optimal capacity.

tickerNews.title: PSAT Sold 4 Ships to Non-Affiliates for Regeneration Purposes
tickerNews.content: Pancaran Samudera Transport (PSAT) announced that it has sold 4 company ships to non-affiliates with a total value of 22 billion rupiah. The sale of these ships - which includes 2 tug boats and 2 barges - is intended for ship regeneration to reduce maintenance costs.
